Package domain

Class ProgramArea

java.lang.Object
domain.ProgramArea
public class ProgramArea
extends java.lang.Object
A class of ProgramArea that has a list of top level blocks. It also contains the currently executed and next to execute blocks.
Version:
4.0
Author:
Andreas Awouters Thomas Van Erum Dirk Vanbeveren Geert Wesemael

  • Method Details

    • nbTopLevelBlocks

      protected int nbTopLevelBlocks()
      The number of top level blocks
      Returns:
      number of top level blocks | result = topLevelBlocks.size()

    • programInProgress

      protected java.lang.Boolean programInProgress()
      Returns true if the program is running.
      Returns:
      true if there is no next block to execute. | nextToExecute != null

    • startExecution

      protected void startExecution() throws java.lang.Exception
      Set the next block to execute to the top level block. This only works if there is only one top level block and the block is a sequence block.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - When there is more than one top level block, the top level block is not a sequence block or the top level block is not a valid starting block.

    • executeNextBlock

      protected ExecutionCommand executeNextBlock​(GameController GC) throws java.lang.Exception
      Execute the next block to execute and set the next/previous/current execute to the right blocks.
      Parameters:
      gameController - The gameController to execute the next function in.
      Returns:
      The execution command of the executed command. | return = programArea.exeCmd
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - When execute is not possible.

    • stopExecution

      protected void stopExecution()
      Stop the execution of the program.

    • addBlock

      protected void addBlock​(PresentationBlock<?> pBlock)
      Add a block to the top level blocks. The block is associated to the given presentationBlock.
      Parameters:
      pBlock - The given presentationblock.

    • removeBlock

      protected void removeBlock​(Block block, GameController GC)
      Remove a block from the top level blocks. The block is associated to the given presentationBlock.
      Parameters:
      pBlock - The given presentationblock.

    • addTopLevelBlock

      protected void addTopLevelBlock​(Block block)
      Add the given block to the list of top level blocks.
      Parameters:
      block - The block to add to topLevelBlocks.

    • removeTopLevelBlock

      protected void removeTopLevelBlock​(Block block)
      Remove the given block from the list of top level blocks.
      Parameters:
      block - The block to remove from topLevelBlocks

    • isTopLevelBlock

      protected boolean isTopLevelBlock​(Block block)
      Check if the given block is a top level block.
      Parameters:
      block - The block to check
      Returns:
      true if the list of top level blocks contains the given block. | topLevelBlocks.contains(block)

    • getNextBlockToExecute

      protected Block getNextBlockToExecute()
      The next block to execute.
      Returns:
      nextToExecute

    • getTopBlocks

      protected java.util.List<Block> getTopBlocks()
      The list of top level blocks.
      Returns:
      topLevelBlocks

    • getCopyOfAllBlocks

      protected java.util.List<Block> getCopyOfAllBlocks()
      A copy of all the blocks in the programArea
      Returns:
      copy of topLevelBlocks

    • getBlocksLeft

      protected int getBlocksLeft()
      The amount of blocks you can add to the programArea.
      Returns:
      blocksLeft

    • getExecutionCommand

      protected ExecutionCommand getExecutionCommand()
      The execution command of the current execution.
      Returns:
      exeCmd

    • getAllFunctionCallsWithID

      protected java.util.List<FunctionCallBlock> getAllFunctionCallsWithID​(int ID)
      Return a list with all the Function Call Blocks that have the same ID as the given ID.
      Parameters:
      ID - The given ID to return the callers of.
      Returns:
      a list with all the Function Call Blocks that have the same ID as the given ID. |Result = all block in getCopyOfAllBlocks() with block.getID() == ID

    • setExecutionCommand

      protected void setExecutionCommand​(ExecutionCommand exeCmd)
      Set the execution command to the given execution command.
      Parameters:
      exeCmd - The execution command
